stu_tags: CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA  EXTRA CREDIT  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: He is a wonderful professor. He has a bigger heart as far as grading concern. he is offering a lots of extra credits. This is my first semester in UB and getting A from this class boost by inspiration is large university. I highly recommended this professor.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (2)  Caring (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Respected (1)
comments: Organic chemistry is a hard class to begin with. Dr. Ahsan tries his best to help his students understand the matierals given. His notes are highlights and key points from the textbook. He truly does care about his students and encourages them to visit his office hours. I hate chemistry but Dr. Ahsan made it interesting and fair to learn

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (2)  Caring (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Respected (1)
comments: This is a really hard class to begin with, and overall, Dr. Ahsan isn\'t the worst professor at UB, but he isn\'t an easy professor. He gives random bonus points so go to class and pay attention, sometimes he will ask you to turn in a problem on the board for bonus points. His tests are hard because there is so much material on them.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (2)  Caring (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Respected (1)
comments: Best organic chemistry professor ever! He makes it interesting and explains it well, and his exams are the fairest exams I\'ve ever seen. They are very similar to the practice exams and homework problems. He is definitely one of the best teachers I\'ve ever had at UB, definitely take him! He\'s also a really nice and understanding guy.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (2)  Caring (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Respected (1)
comments: If you want to take orgo, take it from this guy. He has the best understanding of organic chem BY FAR when compared to the rest of UB\'s crew. He also projects his understanding so that it\'s actually EASY TO COMPREHEND! Seems bogus, but he really is that good at analogies and explanations. Not an easy class but he\'s the best you get for it!

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (2)  Caring (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Respected (1)
comments: This guy is an awesome professor. His down-to-earth teaching style and approachable demeanor make his in-depth knowledge accessible. He frequently sprinkles useful analogies into lectures to send the point home. If you have the chance, take orgo from him. It won\'t be easy, but it will be fair and as accessible as it gets.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (2)  Caring (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Respected (1)
comments: Awesome professor who very well explaining everything in a simple manner. He said everything that would be on the tests and everything that was excluded. Tests will be hard but with orgo in general, tons of homework is needed to do well.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (2)  Caring (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Respected (1)
comments: easily the best Organic Chem teacher at U.B. If you do the homework problems and practice his tests you are guaranteed a B. He is very funny and makes organic chem enjoyable(as unbelievable as it may seem. Most the other professors at U.B. teach right out of the text, he gives his own examples which is very helpful. He also cares about his student.

comments: its true his final is hard. but to get an \'A\', it like a 70%. Do study the practice exams/quizzes. There tend to be a good number of repeat questions. He is very helpful during office hour.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (2)  Caring (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Respected (1)
comments: be prepared to teach yourself everything. i like him as a person not as a teacher. He flies through material. the final you NEED to know at least 80-100 reactions (no joke). stay as far away as possible. i have a B+/A- going in and i hope to come out alive on this final

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (2)  Caring (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Respected (1)
comments: God awful. He expects you to memorize 200 reactions for the final. Its absurd the stuff he is asking on it. I have an A going in, I hope I will have a B+ after this test. And I\'m a chemistry major, so I can\'t imagine what others are feeling. Oh, you will also be teaching yourself everything you need to know, because he certainly doesn\'t teach it.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (2)  Caring (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Respected (1)
comments: I think he is a great teacher. Always willing to help during office hours and tries to make class interesting. He puts a lot of slides emphasizing the material and they get to be redundant after a while thats why he flies through stuff that he has already gone through. Makes exams really similar to practice exams. Really nice guy!
